title: Executive Order 9737-Revoking Section 3 of Executive Order 3928 of April 8, 1942, Relating to the Stabilization of Wages, Prices, and Salaries
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and the statutes, including the First War Powers Act, 1941, as amended, and the Emergency Price Control Act of 1942, as amended, and as President of the United States, it is ordered that section 3 of Executive Order No. 9328 of April 8, 1943, relating to the authority of the Chairman of the War Manpower Commission in connection with the stabilization of wages, prices, and salaries, be, and it is hereby, revoked.

HARRY S. TRUMAN
THE WHITE HOUSE,
June 17, 1946
citation: Harry S Truman, Executive Order 9737-Revoking Section 3 of Executive Order 3928 of April 8, 1942, Relating to the Stabilization of Wages, Prices, and Salaries Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/278613
